question.para: Are there any pre-built scripts available?

answer.para: Yes, there are a few utility scripts are available in the "samples" directory with ".bsh" extension.

question.para: I have written a very useful script to do XYZ, I would like this to be part of the distribution?

answer.para: Yes, we would love to hear from users. Please submit the script to Technical Support, and if this script found to be useful and generic enough for all the customers, we will include the script in the scripts library in the following releases.

question.para: What is different between "connect(<url>)" method and "connectAsAdmin()"?

answer.para: Connect connects to the Teiid system using a VDB name, so you should be able to run any SQL command which is based on that VDB along with Admin method calls. If you use "connectAsAdmin" then you can run all the admin calls but you can not run any SQL commands, and you do not need a VDB to connect to the Teiid system.

question.para: How can I turn on the debug?

answer.programlisting: mmadmin $ debug= true; // to turn it ON mmadmin $ debug= false; // to turn it OFF

question.para: Is IDE support available for writing the scripts?

answer.para: Full IDE support is not available, however eclipse can be used as the editor for developing the scripts. Just set the “.bsh” extension association with Java editor, so all the color syntax is available for your script.
No. Not for the scripts. However, if the scripts are calling into other Java code, those calls can be intercepted and can be run through debugger.
